metaDescription: Find top-rated financial advisors in McKinney. Expert guidance for retirement planning, wealth management, and investment strategies.
heroDescription: McKinney, Texas, is a rapidly growing city known for its vibrant community and economic opportunities.
landscapeDescription: With a population of 148,559, McKinney is part of the thriving Dallas-Fort Worth metroplex. The city boasts a diverse economy with strong growth in technology, retail, and healthcare sectors.
uniqueNeeds: McKinney requires a focus on sustainable growth, affordable housing, and infrastructure development to support its expanding population.
citySpecificRiskAdvice: McKinney's tech sector growth presents concentration risks; housing market appreciation raises bubble concerns. Prepare for tornadoes and flooding; diversify economically.

sections.title: Economic Growth
sections.description: According to BEA (2023), McKinney's economy has expanded by 4.5% year-over-year, driven by job creation in tech and healthcare.

sections.title: Wealth Demographics
sections.description: According to Census (2023), the median household income in McKinney is $92,000, reflecting the city's affluent demographic.

sections.title: Advisor Specializations
sections.description: Based on BLS (2023), financial advisors in McKinney are increasingly specializing in retirement planning and investment management.

sections.title: Cost of Living
sections.description: According to BLS (2024), McKinney's cost of living is 5% lower than the national average, making it an attractive place for families.

sections.title: Real Estate Market
sections.description: According to Zillow (2024), the median home price in McKinney is $400,000, with a 10% increase in the past year, indicating strong demand.

sections.title: Business Environment
sections.description: According to Fortune (2024), McKinney ranks among the top cities for business growth, thanks to its supportive local government and infrastructure.
